alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 5:09AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 509 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tehachapi, California City, Golden Hills, Edwards AFB, Inyokern, China Lake Acres, Stallion Springs, Mojave, Jawbone Canyon, Piutes, Water Canyon, North Edwards, Keene, Indian Wells Canyon and Bear Valley Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
